title: Anthem

title: Anthem
words: And a       word steals into our mind as we look upon our brothers and that       word is fear

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Fear walks through the City fear without       name without shape

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: All men feel it and none dare to speak

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: If this is a vice then we wish no virtue

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Yet our brothers are not like us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: All is not well with our       brothers

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: There are Fraternity 25503 a quiet boy with wise       kind eyes who cry suddenly without reason in the midst of day       or night and their body shakes with sobs they cannot explain

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: There are Solidarity 96347 who are a bright youth without fear       in the day but they scream in their sleep and they scream       Help us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Help us Help us into the night in a voice which       chills our bones but the Doctors cannot cure Solidarity 96347

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And as we all undress at night in the dim light of the candles       our brothers are silent for they dare not speak the thoughts of       their minds

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: For all must agree with all and they cannot know if       their thoughts are the thoughts of all and so they fear to       speak

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And they are glad when the candles are blown for the       night

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But we Equality 72521 look through the window upon the       sky and there is peace in the sky and cleanliness and dignity

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And beyond the City there lies the plain and beyond the plain       black upon the black sky there lies the Uncharted Forest

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We do not wish to look upon the Uncharted Forest

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We do not wish       to think of it

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But ever do our eyes return to that black patch       upon the sky

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Men never enter the Uncharted Forest for there is       no power to explore it and no path to lead among its ancient       trees which stand as guards of fearful secrets

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It is whispered       that once or twice in a hundred years one among the men of the       City escape alone and run to the Uncharted Forest without call       or reason

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: These men do not return

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They perish from hunger and       from the claws of the wild beasts which roam the Forest

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But our       Councils say that this is only a legend

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We have heard that there       are many Uncharted Forests over the land among the Cities

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And       it is whispered that they have grown over the ruins of many       cities of the Unmentionable Times

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The trees have swallowed the       ruins and the bones under the ruins and all the things which       perished

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And as we look upon the Uncharted Forest far in the       night we think of the secrets of the Unmentionable Times

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And we       wonder how it came to pass that these secrets were lost to the       world

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We have heard the legends of the great fighting in which       many men fought on one side and only a few on the other

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: These       few were the Evil Ones and they were conquered

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then great fires       raged over the land

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And in these fires the Evil Ones and all the       things made by the Evil Ones were burned

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And the fire which is       called the Dawn of the Great Rebirth was the Script Fire where       all the scripts of the Evil Ones were burned and with them all       the words of the Evil Ones

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Great mountains of flame stood in the       squares of the Cities for three months

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then came the Great       Rebirth

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The words of the Evil Ones

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The words of the Unmentionable       Times What are the words which we have lost

title: Anthem
words: May the Council have mercy upon us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We had no wish to write such       a question and we knew not what we were doing till we had       written it

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We shall not ask this question and we shall not think       it

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We shall not call death upon our head

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And yet

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And yet

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: There is some word one single word which       is not in the language of men but which had been

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And this is       the Unspeakable Word which no men may speak nor hear

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But       sometimes and it is rare sometimes somewhere one among men       find that word

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They find it upon scraps of old manuscripts or       cut into the fragments of ancient stones

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But when they speak it       they are put to death

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: There is no crime punished by death in       this world save this one crime of speaking the Unspeakable Word

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We have seen one of such men burned alive in the square of the       City

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And it was a sight which has stayed with us through the       years and it haunts us and follows us and it gives us no rest

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We were a child then ten years old

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And we stood in the great       square with all the children and all the men of the City sent to       behold the burning

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They brought the Transgressor out into the       square and they led them to the pyre

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They had torn out the       tongue of the Transgressor so that they could speak no longer

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The Transgressor were young and tall

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They had hair of gold and       eyes blue as morning

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They walked to the pyre and their step did       not falter

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And of all the faces on that square of all the faces       which shrieked and screamed and spat curses upon them theirs was       the calmest and the happiest face

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: As the chains were wound over their body at the stake and a       flame set to the pyre the Transgressor looked upon the City

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: There was a thin thread of blood running from the corner of their       mouth but their lips were smiling

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And a monstrous thought came       to us then which has never left us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We had heard of Saints

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: There are the Saints of Labor and the Saints of the Councils       and the Saints of the Great Rebirth

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But we had never seen a       Saint nor what the likeness of a Saint should be

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And we thought       then standing in the square that the likeness of a Saint was       the face we saw before us in the flames the face of the       Transgressor of the Unspeakable Word

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: As the flames rose a thing happened which no eyes saw but ours       else we would not be living today

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Perhaps it had only seemed to       us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But it seemed to us that the eyes of the Transgressor had       chosen us from the crowd and were looking straight upon us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: There       was no pain in their eyes and no knowledge of the agony of their       body

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: There was only joy in them and pride a pride holier than       is fit for human pride to be

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And it seemed as if these eyes were       trying to tell us something through the flames to send into our       eyes some word without sound

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And it seemed as if these eyes were       begging us to gather that word and not to let it go from us and       from the earth

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But the flames rose and we could not guess the       word       Whateven if we have to burn for it like the Saint of the       Pyrewhat is the Unspeakable Word

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: PART THREE       We Equality 72521 have discovered a new power of nature

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And       we have discovered it alone and we alone are to know it

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It is said

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Now let us be lashed for it if we must

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The Council       of Scholars has said that we all know the things which exist and       therefore the things which are not known by all do not exist

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But       we think that the Council of Scholars is blind

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The secrets of       this earth are not for all men to see but only for those who       will seek them

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We know for we have found a secret unknown to       all our brothers

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We know not what this power is nor whence it comes

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But we know       its nature we have watched it and worked with it

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We saw it       first two years ago

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: One night we were cutting open the body of       a dead frog when we saw its leg jerking

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It was dead yet it       moved

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Some power unknown to men was making it move

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We could not       understand it

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then after many tests we found the answer

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The       frog had been hanging on a wire of copper and it had been the       metal of our knife which had sent the strange power to the copper       through the brine of the frogs body

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We put a piece of copper       and a piece of zinc into a jar of brine we touched a wire to       them and there under our fingers was a miracle which had never       occurred before a new miracle and a new power

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: This discovery haunted us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We followed it in preference to all       our studies

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We worked with it we tested it in more ways than we       can describe and each step was as another miracle unveiling       before us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We came to know that we had found the greatest power       on earth

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: For it defies all the laws known to men

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It makes the       needle move and turn on the compass which we stole from the Home       of the Scholars but we had been taught when still a child that       the loadstone points to the north and that this is a law which       nothing can change yet our new power defies all laws

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We found       that it causes lightning and never have men known what causes       lightning

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: In thunderstorms we raised a tall rod of iron by the       side of our hole and we watched it from below

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We have seen the       lightning strike it again and again

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And now we know that metal       draws the power of the sky and that metal can be made to give it       forth

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We have built strange things with this discovery of ours

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We used       for it the copper wires which we found here under the ground

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We       have walked the length of our tunnel with a candle lighting the       way

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We could go no farther than half a mile for earth and rock       had fallen at both ends

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But we gathered all the things we found       and we brought them to our work place

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We found strange boxes       with bars of metal inside with many cords and strands and coils       of metal

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We found wires that led to strange little globes of       glass on the walls they contained threads of metal thinner than       a spiders web

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: These things help us in our work

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We do not understand them but       we think that the men of the Unmentionable Times had known our       power of the sky and these things had some relation to it

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We do       not know but we shall learn

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Labor

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Scholars

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We cannot stop now even though it       frightens us that we are alone in our knowledge

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: No single one can possess greater wisdom than the many Scholars       who are elected by all men for their wisdom

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Yet we can

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We do

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We have fought against saying it but now it is said

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We do not       care

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We forget all men all laws and all things save our metals       and our wires

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: So much is still to be learned

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: So long a road       lies before us and what care we if we must travel it alone

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: PART FOUR       Many days passed before we could speak to the Golden One again

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But then came the day when the sky turned white as if the sun       had burst and spread its flame in the air and the fields lay       still without breath and the dust of the road was white in the       glow

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: So the women of the field were weary and they tarried over       their work and they were far from the road when we came

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But the       Golden One stood alone at the hedge waiting

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We stopped and we       saw that their eyes so hard and scornful to the world were       looking at us as if they would obey any word we might speak

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And we said       We have given you a name in our thoughts Liberty 53000

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: What is our name

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: they asked

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The Golden One       Nor do we call you Equality 72521 when we think of you       What name have you given us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They looked straight into our eyes       and they held their head high and they answered       The Unconquered

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: For a long time we could not speak

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then we said       Such thoughts as these are forbidden Golden One       But you think such thoughts as these and you wish us to think       them

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We looked into their eyes and we could not lie

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Yes we whispered and they smiled and then we said Our       dearest one do not obey us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They stepped back and their eyes were wide and still

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Speak these words again they whispered

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Which words we asked

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But they did not answer and we knew it

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Our dearest one we whispered

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Never have men said this to women

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The head of the Golden One bowed slowly and they stood still       before us their arms at their sides the palms of their hands       turned to us as if their body were delivered in submission to       our eyes

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And we could not speak

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then they raised their head and they spoke simply and gently as       if they wished us to forget some anxiety of their own

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The day is hot they said and you have worked for many hours       and you must be weary

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: No we answered

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It is cooler in the fields they said and there is water to       drink

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Are you thirsty       Yes we answered but we cannot cross the hedge

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We shall bring the water to you they said

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then they knelt by the moat they gathered water in their two       hands they rose and they held the water out to our lips

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We do not know if we drank that water

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We only knew suddenly that       their hands were empty but we were still holding our lips to       their hands and that they knew it but did not move

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We raised our head and stepped back

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: For we did not understand       what had made us do this and we were afraid to understand it

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And the Golden One stepped back and stood looking upon their       hands in wonder

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then the Golden One moved away even though no       others were coming and they moved stepping back as if they       could not turn from us their arms bent before them as if they       could not lower their hands

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: PART FIVE       We made it

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We created it

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We brought it forth from the night of       the ages

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We alone

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Our hands

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Our mind

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Ours alone and only

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We know not what we are saying

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Our head is reeling

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We look upon       the light which we have made

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We shall be forgiven for anything       we say tonight       Tonight after more days and trials than we can count we       finished building a strange thing from the remains of the       Unmentionable Times a box of glass devised to give forth the       power of the sky of greater strength than we had ever achieved       before

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And when we put our wires to this box when we closed the       currentthe wire glowed

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It came to life it turned red and a       circle of light lay on the stone before us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We stood and we held our head in our hands

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We could not       conceive of that which we had created

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We had touched no flint       made no fire

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Yet here was light light that came from nowhere       light from the heart of metal

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We blew out the candle

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Darkness swallowed us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: There was nothing       left around us nothing save night and a thin thread of flame in       it as a crack in the wall of a prison

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We stretched our hands to       the wire and we saw our fingers in the red glow

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We could not       see our body nor feel it and in that moment nothing existed save       our two hands over a wire glowing in a black abyss

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then we thought of the meaning of that which lay before us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We       can light our tunnel and the City and all the Cities of the       world with nothing save metal and wires

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We can give our brothers       a new light cleaner and brighter than any they have ever known

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The power of the sky can be made to do mens bidding

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: There are       no limits to its secrets and its might and it can be made to       grant us anything if we but choose to ask

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then we knew what we must do

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Our discovery is too great for us       to waste our time in sweeping the streets

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We must not keep our       secret to ourselves nor buried under the ground

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We must bring       it into the sight of all men

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We need all our time we need the       work rooms of the Home of the Scholars we want the help of our       brother Scholars and their wisdom joined to ours

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: There is so       much work ahead for all of us for all the Scholars of the world

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: In a month the World Council of Scholars is to meet in our City

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It is a great Council to which the wisest of all lands are       elected and it meets once a year in the different Cities of the       earth

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We shall go to this Council and we shall lay before them       as our gift this glass box with the power of the sky

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We shall       confess everything to them

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They will see understand and       forgive

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: For our gift is greater than our transgression

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They       will explain it to the Council of Vocations and we shall be       assigned to the Home of the Scholars

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: This has never been done       before but neither has a gift such as ours ever been offered to       men

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We must wait

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We must guard our tunnel as we had never guarded it       before

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: For should any men save the Scholars learn of our secret       they would not understand it nor would they believe us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They       would see nothing save our crime of working alone and they       would destroy us and our light

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We care not about our body but       our light is       Yes we do care

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: For the first time do we care about our body

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: For this wire is as a part of our body as a vein torn from us       glowing with our blood

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Are we proud of this thread of metal or       of our hands which made it or is there a line to divide these       two

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We stretch out our arms

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: For the first time do we know how strong       our arms are

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And a strange thought comes to us we wonder for       the first time in our life what we look like

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Men never see       their own faces and never ask their brothers about it for it is       evil to have concern for their own faces or bodies

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But tonight       for a reason we cannot fathom we wish it were possible to us to       know the likeness of our own person

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: PART SIX       We have not written for thirty days

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: For thirty days we have not       been here in our tunnel

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We had been caught

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It happened on that       night when we wrote last

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We forgot that night to watch the       sand in the glass which tells us when three hours have passed and       it is time to return to the City Theatre

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: When we remembered it       the sand had run out

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We hastened to the Theatre

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But the big tent stood grey and       silent against the sky

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The streets of the City lay before us       dark and empty

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: If we went back to hide in our tunnel we would       be found and our light found with us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: So we walked to the Home of       the Street Sweepers

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: When the Council of the Home questioned us we looked upon the       faces of the Council but there was no curiosity in those faces       and no anger and no mercy

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: So when the oldest of them asked us       Where have you been we thought of our glass box and of our       light and we forgot all else

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And we answered       We will not tell you

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The oldest did not question us further

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They turned to the two       youngest and said and their voice was bored       Take our brother Equality 72521 to the Palace of Corrective       Detention

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Lash them until they tell

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: So we were taken to the Stone Room under the Palace of Corrective       Detention

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: This room has no windows and it is empty save for an       iron post

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Two men stood by the post naked but for leather       aprons and leather hoods over their faces

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Those who had brought       us departed leaving us to the two Judges who stood in a corner       of the room

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The Judges were small thin men grey and bent

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They       gave the signal to the two strong hooded ones

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They tore the clothes from our body they threw us down upon our       knees and they tied our hands to the iron post

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The first blow of       the lash felt as if our spine had been cut in two

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The second       blow stopped the first and for a second we felt nothing then

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Tonight

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: the pain struck us in our throat and fire ran in our lungs       without air

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But we did not cry out

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The lash whistled like a singing wind

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We tried to count the       blows but we lost count

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We knew that the blows were falling       upon our back

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Only we felt nothing upon our back any longer

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: A       flaming grill kept dancing before our eyes and we thought of       nothing save that grill a grill a grill of red squares and       then we knew that we were looking at the squares of the iron       grill in the door and there were also the squares of stone on       the walls and the squares which the lash was cutting upon our       back crossing and recrossing itself in our flesh

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then we saw a fist before us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It knocked our chin up and we saw       the red froth of our mouth on the withered fingers and the Judge       asked       Where have you been

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But we jerked our head away hid our face upon our tied hands       and bit our lips

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The lash whistled again

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We wondered who was sprinkling burning       coal dust upon the floor for we saw drops of red twinkling on       the stones around us

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then we knew nothing save two voices snarling steadily one       after the other even though we knew they were speaking many       minutes apart       Where have you been where have you been where have you been       where have you been       And our lips moved but the sound trickled back into our throat       and the sound was only       The light

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The light

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The light       Then we knew nothing

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We opened our eyes lying on our stomach on the brick floor of a       cell

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We looked upon two hands lying far before us on the bricks       and we moved them and we knew that they were our hands

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But we       could not move our body

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then we smiled for we thought of the       light and that we had not betrayed it

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We lay in our cell for many days

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The door opened twice each day       once for the men who brought us bread and water and once for the       Judges

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Many Judges came to our cell first the humblest and then       the most honored Judges of the City

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They stood before us in       their white togas and they asked       Are you ready to speak

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But we shook our head lying before them on the floor

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And they       departed

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We counted each day and each night as it passed

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then tonight       we knew that we must escape

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: For tomorrow the World Council of       Scholars is to meet in our City

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It was easy to escape from the Palace of Corrective Detention

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The locks are old on the doors and there are no guards about

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: There is no reason to have guards for men have never defied the       Councils so far as to escape from whatever place they were       ordered to be

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Our body is healthy and strength returns to it       speedily

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We lunged against the door and it gave way

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We stole       through the dark passages and through the dark streets and down       into our tunnel

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We lit the candle and we saw that our place had not been found       and nothing had been touched

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And our glass box stood before us       on the cold oven as we had left it

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: What matter they now the       scars upon our back

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Tomorrow in the full light of day we shall take our box and       leave our tunnel open and walk through the streets to the Home       of the Scholars

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We shall put before them the greatest gift ever       offered to men

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We shall tell them the truth

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We shall hand to       them as our confession these pages we have written

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We shall       join our hands to theirs and we shall work together with the       power of the sky for the glory of mankind

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Our blessing upon       you our brothers

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Tomorrow you will take us back into your fold       and we shall be an outcast no longer

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Tomorrow we shall be one of       you again

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Tomorrow       PART SEVEN       It is dark here in the forest

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The leaves rustle over our head       black against the last gold of the sky

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The moss is soft and       warm

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We shall sleep on this moss for many nights till the       beasts of the forest come to tear our body

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We have no bed now       save the moss and no future save the beasts

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We are old now yet we were young this morning when we carried       our glass box through the streets of the City to the Home of the       Scholars

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: No men stopped us for there were none about from the       Palace of Corrective Detention and the others knew nothing

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: No       men stopped us at the gate

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We walked through empty passages and       into the great hall where the World Council of Scholars sat in       solemn meeting

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We saw nothing as we entered save the sky in the great windows       blue and glowing

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then we saw the Scholars who sat around a long       table they were as shapeless clouds huddled at the rise of the       great sky

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: There were men whose famous names we knew and others       from distant lands whose names we had not heard

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We saw a great       painting on the wall over their heads of the twenty illustrious       men who had invented the candle

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: All the heads of the Council turned to us as we entered

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: These       great and wise of the earth did not know what to think of us and       they looked upon us with wonder and curiosity as if we were a       miracle

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It is true that our tunic was torn and stained with       brown stains which had been blood

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We raised our right arm and we       said       Our greeting to you our honored brothers of the World Council       of Scholars

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then Collective 00009 the oldest and wisest of the Council       spoke and asked       Who are you our brother

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: For you do not look like a Scholar

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Our name is Equality 72521 we answered and we are a Street       Sweeper of this City

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then it was as if a great wind had stricken the hall for all the       Scholars spoke at once and they were angry and frightened

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: A Street Sweeper

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: A Street Sweeper walking in upon the World       Council of Scholars

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It is not to be believed

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It is against all       the rules and all the laws

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But we knew how to stop them

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Our brothers

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: we said

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We matter not nor our transgression

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It is only our brother men who matter

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Give no thought to us for       we are nothing but listen to our words for we bring you a gift       such as had never been brought to men

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Listen to us for we hold       the future of mankind in our hands

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then they listened

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We placed our glass box upon the table before them

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We spoke of       it and of our long quest and of our tunnel and of our escape       from the Palace of Corrective Detention

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Not a hand moved in that       hall as we spoke nor an eye

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then we put the wires to the box       and they all bent forward and sat still watching

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And we stood       still our eyes upon the wire

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: And slowly slowly as a flush of       blood a red flame trembled in the wire

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Then the wire glowed

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But terror struck the men of the Council

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They leapt to their       feet they ran from the table and they stood pressed against the       wall huddled together seeking the warmth of one anothers       bodies to give them courage

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We looked upon them and we laughed and said       Fear nothing our brothers

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: There is a great power in these       wires but this power is tamed

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: It is yours

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We give it to you

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Still they would not move

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We give you the power of the sky we cried

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: We give you the       key to the earth

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Take it and let us be one of you the humblest       among you

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Let us all work together and harness this power and       make it ease the toil of men

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Let us throw away our candles and       our torches

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Let us flood our cities with light

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Let us bring a       new light to men

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: But they looked upon us and suddenly we were afraid

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: For their       eyes were still and small and evil

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Our brothers

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: we cried

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Have you nothing to say to us       Then Collective 00009 moved forward

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: They moved to the table and       the others followed

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Yes spoke Collective 00009 we have much to say to you

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: The sound of their voices brought silence to the hall and to beat       of our heart

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: Yes said Collective 00009 we have much to say to a wretch       who have broken all the laws and who boast of their infamy

author: Rand, Ayn
title: Anthem
words: How dared you think that your mind held greater wisdom than the       minds of your brothers

author: Rand, Ayn

world women in long skirts or cheap printed cotton dresses carrying bundles of sticks or baskets or plastic buckets of water from some river or
other with babies slung on them in shawls or net slings looking squinteyed or afraid out of the screen at us knowing something was being done to
them by a machine with one glass eye but not knowing what Those movies were comforting and faintly boring
